alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 12:45PM MST until August 24 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 1245 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cow Springs, Tonalea, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 333 and 371. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Porcupine Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Begashibito Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Narrow Wash, Shonto Wash, Sour Water Wash, Navajo Creek, Bitter Spring Wash and Yellow Butte Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
